metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1582 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
LXD before 2.0.2 does not properly set permissions when switching anunprivileged container into privileged mode, which allows local users toaccess arbitrary world readable paths in the container directory viaunspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1582` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lxc2 - 2.0.2-0ubuntu1~16.04.1
lxd - 2.0.2-0ubuntu1~16.04.1
lxd-client - 2.0.2-0ubuntu1~16.04.1
lxd-tools - 2.0.2-0ubuntu1~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: lxd package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.2-0ubuntu1~16.04.1').
